comment: Goated professor, you literally have to try to fail, quizzes and exams are open note, have 1 project. That is about it. She is chill, if you are an IT major and have to take this class to satisfy a credit, take her, she is goated. Work is self-explanatory
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall, this is an easy but valuable course. There are weekly quizzes based on the assigned readings and videos, but you get 3 attempts for each one. The exams are essentially made up of questions from the previous quizzes, though you only get 1 try. There is one major term project, which is easy if you already have coding experience.

Great professor. Lectures were more than just slides. She'd work on the board and even brought us a guest speaker. She had lots of materials for studying. Fair grader, open book tests, and she ended class 3 weeks early meaning we had loads of time to study for our final. Excellently organized class.

Few grades but no lockdown on tests or quizzes. Hard concepts but there are plenty of helpful resources. Biggest grade is a Term Project but the grading was very nice, I believe almost all of the class got a 93 and up on the project and it was basic coding. Would definitely take this professor again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken this professor before for ethics she's really chill and laid back with assignments and grading, assignments are relatively easy. Quizzes and tests are open book open resources. The class consists of discussion posts, assignments and quizzes. Very easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Zhang's class was so easy that I'm still not sure I even took it. Videos were pretty interesting and tests and quizzes were a breeze. One quiz a week and 3 tests split evenly in the semester. Had one term project which you do solo which required some coding and it was pretty fun to do. Overall, I highly recommend this professor!

Prof Zhang was great for Software Testing & QA. 5 assignments (30%), mid-term & final (20% each), 8 quizzes (20%), & 10 discussions (10%). Quizzes and tests are easy with it being open book and the questions pulled from the text. Took online. Learned a lot while not having to try super hard.
Very relaxed and easy class. Do your work and read the modules and you will get an A.

She teaches very well. I loved her a lot. My group never participated in any of my presentations so I basically did everything. She ended up helping me out and said I didn't have to present because I always come to class and always did everything on my own. She knows what she is talking about. Very kind person.

Wenyu Zhang is suuuper easy. She reads her slides kinda verbatim but not hard at all, class is a little boring but participation; which is basically presenting some impromptu projects (which you need to be in class to know about). Other than that the class is entirely opinion based. Her test/quizzes however are long and short answers.

Very easy class! Professor Zhang is willing to answer any questions you have as well. Every lecture was just a video taken from this other professor, Jim Rutherfood. He is a retired teach from KSU as well, but his lectures are fantastic. The material is easy to absorb.

A great professor that gives very interesting and informative lectures. The material taught in class keeps your attention and if it does not, you do not really need to pay much attention anyways. There are some group assignments that are pretty easy if you all work together.

Easiest CS course you can take. She almost never had class on Fridays, and literally everything was open note/book. Good course to take if you have a heavy workload and need some extra credits. If you pay attention it'll also make Data Structures and other project-heavy CS/SWE classes a little less difficult.

Professor Zhang really gives nice feedback whenever you need it. She is even willing to let you resubmit project documents if she feels they are not good enough. Only bad thing can be a group project but if you can manage you will do well in class. Everything is open book test, unlimited time. Take her!!!

Professor Zhang seemed to have good intentions and quickly responded to emails, but they bit off more than they could chew this semester. The group project is what made this semester awful. The project instructions and rubrics were so poorly put together that my team and I were guessing our way through it. Try to avoid for this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: He is essentially the only professor for this class. He is pretty easy.

Professor Zhang's online class (CSE2300) was very reasonable and not difficult. There are 3 tests, 9 quizzes, and a term project involving some coding. All his tests and quizzes are on d2l. No discussion posts! I highly recommend this professor if you want an easy A.

Professor Zhang is a great instructor. The material for Ethics is pretty straightforward, assignments and discussions are reasonably easy to complete. She structures her classes very well (some online classes at KSU are a mess of broken hyperlinks and conflicting info). She's also a fast grader, which is appreciated. Highly recommend.

As others have reviewed, the course was easy enough that the professor didn't really need to "teach." No lectures, just online textbooks and PowerPoint presentations with simple assignments, quizzes, and discussions. However, Professor Zhang was always very nice and polite, graded fairly, and seemed to care about the class. Recommended!

Prof Zhang didn't really teach online but it wasn't necessary for ethics. The class is really easy. Discussions weekly, a few assignments, two easy group projects, and 3 tests. All of it was not too bad and no lockdown. Do all of the work and you will probably get an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Not really teaching the class but everything is pretty self-explanatory and the professor sends out a notification every week letting you know what's due. Discussions, a few easy assignments, two group projects that are easy, and tests. The tests are all short answer and timed so you gotta be speedy to finish. Not too hard though, would take again
